titles.title: Alaska Amchitka Island Workers' Relief Amendments of 2000

To amend the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act to include workers who were employed on Amchitka Island, Alaska, in the construction and maintenance of deep shafts for underground nuclear testing and various other military purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 6/6/2000--Introduced. Alaska Amchitka Island Workers' Relief Amendments of 2000 - Amends the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act to set forth eligibility criteria governing claims for compensation submitted by Amchitka Island workers in connection with exposure to Federal facilities and underground nuclear testing on Amchitka Island.
